text: Identification and characterization of a leukocyte - specific component of the nuclear body .
The nuclear body ( NB ) is a cellular organelle that is involved in the pathogenesis of acute promyelocytic leukemia and viral infection .
The NB is also a target of antibodies in the serum of patients with the autoimmune disease primary biliary cirrhosis .

In this study , serum from a patient with primary biliary cirrhosis was used to identify a cDNA encoding a novel component of the NB , a 140-kDa protein designated <extra_id_0> Sp140 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> .

The predicted amino acid sequence of the amino-terminal portion of <extra_id_0> Sp140 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> was similar to <extra_id_0> Sp100 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , a previously identified NB protein .
The carboxyl portion of <extra_id_0> Sp140 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> contained a zinc-finger domain and a bromodomain , motifs that are present in proteins regulating gene transcription .
High levels of <extra_id_0> Sp140 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> mRNA were detected in human spleen and peripheral blood leukocytes , but not other human tissues .

text: The level of <extra_id_0> SP140 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> mRNA in myeloid precursor cell lines HL60 and NB4 markedly increased in response to chemically induced cellular differentiation .

text: Immunohistochemical techniques were used to demonstrate that <extra_id_0> SP140 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> localized to the NB in differentiated HL60 and NB4 cells .

The location of <extra_id_0> Sp140 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> in the NB , and expression of this gene in cells involved in host defense , suggest that <extra_id_0> Sp140 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> may be involved in the pathogenesis of acute promyelocytic leukemia and viral infection .
